metadata.title: CVE-2017-9611 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
The Ins_MIRP function in base/ttinterp.c in Artifex Ghostscript GhostXPS9.21 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (heap-basedbuffer over-read and application crash) or possibly have unspecified otherimpact via a crafted document.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-9611` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ghostscript - 9.18~dfsg~0-0ubuntu2.7
ghostscript-x - 9.18~dfsg~0-0ubuntu2.7
libgs9 - 9.18~dfsg~0-0ubuntu2.7
libgs9-common - 9.18~dfsg~0-0ubuntu2.7
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ghostscript package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '9.18~dfsg~0-0ubuntu2.7').
